column5: i'm lucille, forester from albuquerque, new mexico, and i want to commend caleb. yesterday for representing our group. he not only remembered his question, even though he wasn't the first choice, but was able to represent us. well, thanks, caleb.
everybody, good to see y'all again. and i do have to admit that they send the chat via the question to me via zoom. so i was able to read it right off the screen. so i admit to cheating
but looking forward to talking with you all again.
jim walker. hide everybody from ohio could see everybody.
a and stevie, hopefully my speaker. sure fun things for work today.

4. [A] Reason: Implementing a term limit for Supreme Court Justices is seen as a positive change because it can help ensure a more diverse and dynamic judiciary. It allows for new perspectives and fresh ideas to be brought to the court, preventing justices from becoming too entrenched in their positions and potentially out of touch with societal changes.

5. [B] Reason: Implementing a term limit for Supreme Court Justices is seen as a negative change because it can disrupt the stability and continuity of the court. Justices with experience and expertise may be forced to leave the court, potentially leading to a loss of institutional knowledge and a less effective judiciary. Additionally, it may politicize the court even further, as justices may be more inclined to make decisions based on short-term political considerations rather than long-term legal principles.

column34:
4. [A] Reason: Implementing RCV as an alternative method to elected officials and representatives at all levels can be seen as a positive change because it allows for a more inclusive and representative democracy. RCV ensures that the candidate with the most support from voters is elected, even if they are not the first choice of the majority. This promotes fair representation and encourages candidates to appeal to a broader range of voters.

5. [B] Reason: Implementing RCV as an alternative method to elected officials and representatives at all levels can be seen as negative because it may complicate the voting process and lead to confusion among voters. RCV requires voters to rank candidates in order of preference, which can be more complex than a traditional voting system. Additionally, some argue that RCV can still result in the election of candidates who are not the most popular choice among voters, as it depends on the redistribution of preferences from eliminated candidates.

column5: i agree with many of the others. i think that the 18 year term is a good idea. i think when it was first proposed, lifespans were a lot shorter and they didn't envision, people staying on the court, 30, 40 years. i also think that there should be ethics, there should be some standard for these judges and they should be impeachable if they're not held up to their standards as for the sighs, i don't think we need a constitutional amendment to adjust the size. i think, leave it at 9 and maybe there'll be some reason to change it in the future.
column7:
1. The 18-year term for Supreme Court justices is a good idea.
2. Lifespans were shorter when the Supreme Court was first established, so they didn't anticipate justices staying on the court for 30-40 years.
3. There should be ethics and standards for judges, and they should be impeachable if they don't meet those standards.
4. There is no need for a constitutional amendment to adjust the size of the Supreme Court.
5. The speaker suggests leaving the size of the Supreme Court at 9, but acknowledges that it may change in the future if there is a valid reason.
